<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module2_mcq_q44')" data-correct-answer="C">
<strong style="display: block;">
Which of the following statements about the **market risk premium** is correct?
</strong>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q44" value="A"> A. The market risk premium equals the variance of the market portfolio.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q44" value="B"> B. The market risk premium is the difference between a stock’s expected return and the risk-free rate.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q44" value="C"> C. The market risk premium is the additional return investors require for holding the market portfolio instead of the risk-free asset, i.e., \(E[R_m] - R_f\).</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q44" value="D"> D. The market risk premium is always equal to the risk-free rate.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q44" value="E"> E. The market risk premium disappears in a well-diversified portfolio.</label><br>
</form>
<div id="feedback-module2_mcq_q44" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: C. The **market risk premium** is defined as the excess return of the market portfolio over the risk-free rate, \(E[R_m] - R_f\).  
It represents the reward investors demand for bearing systematic risk, and it is central to the CAPM equation.
</div>
:::
